alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 5:32PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Tuscaloosa County through 630 PM CDT... At 532 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Jena, or 7 miles southeast of Gordo, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northern Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Coker, Samantha, Lake Lurleen State Park, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, Binion Creek Landing, Whitson, Lake Tuscaloosa, Moores Bridge, Windham Springs, Flatwoods, Lake Harris, Lake Nicol, Wiley, Echola, Highway 69 Bridge and Oliver Lock And Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
